1: Jack Brennan, Vanguard Chairman and CEO (ret.)
episodes.description:
In the inaugural episode of Benchwarmers: Conversations about Culture, Jack Swarbrick sits down with Jack Brennan who served as CEO and Chairman of Vanguard, and is currently in his second term as Chairman of the Board of the University of Notre Dame.

Benchwarmers is a series of Conversations about Culture, featuring Notre Dame vice-president and James E. Rohr Director of Athletics Jack Swarbrick. Each episode, Jack is joined by a key leader to discuss what it takes to build, inspire and maintain strong, winning cultures.

Check out the video version of the show on the Fighting Irish YouTube channe (http://youtube.com/notredameathletics) l.

Canon Solutions America is proud to present Benchwarmers: Conversations on Culture. Our expert team tackles your managed services needs with powerful processes that transform operations, letting you focus on your core business. Contact us today at http://csa.canon.com/GMS.

episodes.title: 3: Brave Voices - Katlyn Gilbert (Notre Dame Women's Basketball)
episodes.description:
Brave Voices is a podcast presented by Fighting Irish Media and Notre Dame Athletics.

Brave Voices is hosted by former Track and Field athlete and current FIM Producer, Indi Jackson. It will feature interviews with Black Notre Dame student-athletes to talk about race in their life in whatever form or fashion that they want.

In episode 3, Indi talks with Notre Dame Women's Basketball player, Katlyn Gilbert (https://und.com/roster/katlyn-gilbert/) .  They discussed Katlyn's experience at Notre Dame and how hateful comments on social media have impacted them as Black student athletes.  

The goal of this show is to ease the tension around this topic.  So sit back, listen, and learn!  It might be awkward...but only for now!

Make sure to RATE and REVIEW and also download and SUBSCRIBE (https://audioboom.com/channels/4942689) !

43: Stronger Scars -Abbie Lee - The Prescription Playbook
episodes.description:
Join host Bailey Cartwright as she and her guests embrace the strength found in their scars!

In this week's episode, Bailey and Tony chat with Abbie Lee from the Prescription Playbook and The Illinois Human Performance Project (https://ilhpp.org/prescription-playbook/) .

They discuss what the Prescription Playbook does to help adolescents approach opioids and how to ensure that athletes don't end up abusing pain medication.

The group discuss how pain management plays a role in athletics and what steps can be taken to make sure athletes are able to prevent misuse and abuse of prescription drugs.

Make sure to rate and review!

episodes.title: 3: Monogram Club Member-to-Member: Soccer stories with Kate Markgraf & Max Lachowecki
episodes.description: Former Fighting Irish soccer standouts Kate Markgraf (’98) and Max Lachowecki (’15) share stories from their time at Notre Dame, which included both winning a national championship, and beyond. Markgraf enjoyed a stellar career with the U.S. Women’s National Team, and she now is general manager of that organization. She also serves as vice president of the Monogram Club. Lachowecki recently returned to professional soccer following a year off. He shares his story about what led him back to the game.

They talk about the surgery Kenzie had immediately after birth and how it has affected her throughout her life and playing career.  They cover how she and Bailey have handled being injured at the same time and how they have stayed close throughout the process.

Later they discuss some of the antics of their childhood and share some stories from their youth soccer days!

Make sure to rate and review!

episodes.title: Introducing: Monogram Club Member-to-Member
episodes.description:
Subscribe to Monogram Club Member to Member here (https://audioboom.com/channels/5027147) . 

The first episode of the Member-to-Member podcast features Monogram Club president Don Casey ('82, '83, swimming), staff member Reggie Brooks ('93, football), board member Jes Christian ('14, track & field) and executive director Matt Weldy.

The group discusses racial injustice within the U.S. and their personal experiences related to that topic. They also talk about what the upcoming academic and athletic year may look like as a result of the pandemic, and the launch of the Monogram Club's 'Era Extended' initiative series.

episodes.title: 36: Stronger Scars - Tim Howard - USMNT Goalkeeper
episodes.description:
Join host Bailey Cartwright as she and her guests embrace the strength found in their scars!
In this week's episode, Bailey sits down with Soccer LEGEND, and former U.S. Men's National Team Goalkeeper, Tim Howard.
They discuss his relatively healthy professional soccer career, how he managed to avoid injuries and how he approached rehab the few times he was sidelined.
Later, they talk about how he helps his daughter approach the game of soccer and where he thinks youth soccer in America can improve.
They also discuss his historic USMNT performances, including his record-setting performance in 2014 against Belgium.
Finally, they chat about the topic of race in the United States and what can be done to work towards eliminating racism.
This is an ALL-TIME GREAT episode!
Make sure to rate and review! Download Stronger Scars HERE (https://audioboom.com/channels/4976076) and Subscribe to Radio Free Irish HERE (https://audioboom.com/channels/4011493) !

episodes.title: 9. Women's Tennis (Cam Corse, Ally Bojczuk, and Page Freeman)
episodes.description:
This is Unforgotten, Stories From a Lost Season.
In the ninth episode, Tony talks with Women's Tennis players, Cam Corse, Ally Bojczuk, and Page Freeman.
The Notre Dame Women's team was ranked as high as No. 15 in the country in 2020 and was 11-5 to begin the season.  Cam, Ally, and Page detail how they learned their season would be cancelled and how to handled the news as a team.
Later, they discuss how they have handled the months at home and managed to stay in touch during the pandemic.
Finally, the group chats about how their team has rallied together during the pandemic and what they are most excited to do once they get back on campus!
Make sure to download and subscribe to Radio Free Irish (https://audioboom.com/channels/4011493) !
You can email us at fidm@nd.edu (mailto:mailto:fidm@nd.edu?subject=Podcast%20Feedback) or check out http://und.com/podcasts.

episodes.title: 35: Stronger Scars - Haley Scott De Maria - Notre Dame Swimming ('95)
episodes.description:
Join host Bailey Cartwright as she and her guests embrace the strength found in their scars!
In this week's episode, Bailey sits down with former Notre Dame Swimmer, Haley Scott De Maria.
Haley recounts the bus crash (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=of898tzIkd4) on the way back from a meet that changed her life in 1992.  She discusses the night itself and the road to recovery that led to her returning to the pool in 1993!
Later, the group discusses what her mentality was like throughout the rehab process and how many years it took to be able to write the book (https://www.haleybook.com/) about her injury.
This is one of the most inspirational episodes ever!
Make sure to rate and review! Download Stronger Scars HERE (https://audioboom.com/channels/4976076) and Subscribe to Radio Free Irish HERE (https://audioboom.com/channels/4011493) !

episodes.title: Run It Back - 2013 ND Men's Basketball vs Louisville (5OT) - Jack Cooley and Eric Atkins
episodes.description:
Welcome to "Run It Back"!  Over the course of this show, we will relive some of the best games in Notre Dame history with the players and personalities that made them memorable!
This episode features the Notre Dame Men's Basketball win over Louisville in five (5!!!!!) overtimes in 2013!  It remains the longest regular season game in Big East History and the longest game in Notre Dame Men's Basketball history.
Tony is joined by Jack Cooley (https://und.com/roster/jack-cooley/) and Eric Atkins (https://und.com/roster/eric-atkins/) and the break down some of the biggest plays throughout the game.
Make sure to check out the 28 seconds of Jerian Grant (https://youtu.be/PV-AF-88uKs) and the ICON episode produced by FIM (https://youtu.be/s0f3WanSYT0) after the game!
Later, they discuss their fondest memories both on and off the floor and why Eric deserves more credit for his offensive performance in the 5th OT!
Make sure to download and subscribe here (https://audioboom.com/channels/4011493) and please leave us a rating and review!
You can email us at fidm@nd.edu (mailto:mailto:fidm@nd.edu?subject=Podcast%20Feedback) or check out http://und.com/podcasts.

episodes.description:
This is Unforgotten, Stories From a Lost Season.
In the seventh episode of Unforgotten, Tony chats with Notre Dame Swimming and Diving team members, Luciana Thomas, Sadler McKeen, and Kelly Straub.
The Notre Dame Diving Teem was in the midst of a meet when they learned that their season would be cancelled.  Kelly details how they learned and how they finished their dives before the season came to an end.
The swimming team was training for ACC Championships.  Sadler and Luciana discuss how they learned their season would be cut short as well.
Later, the group chats about how their team has rallied together during the pandemic and what they are most excited to do once they get back on campus!

episodes.title: 34: Stronger Scars - Abby Prohaska - Notre Dame Women's Basketball ('21)
episodes.description:
Join host Bailey Cartwright as she and her guests embrace the strength found in their scars!
In this week's episode, Bailey sits down with Notre Dame Women’s Basketball Player, Abby Prohaska (https://und.com/roster/abby-prohaska/) .
They cover Abby's being diagnosed with Bilateral Pulmonary Embolism (a blood clot in the lungs) (https://www.instagram.com/p/B4ck_wjAKUC/?hl=en) before the start of last season and how she handled receiving the news she would not be able to play in 2019-20.
Later, they chat about how she stayed engaged with her team while not being able to play and detailed the steps she and the Notre Dame medical staff took to ensure she could recover healthily and safely throughout the year.
They also discuss what it was like to receive encouragement from so many family, friends, and fans, including NBA Star, Steph Curry (https://twitter.com/abbyproha/status/1195089160593453067?s=20) !
Make sure to rate and review! Download Stronger Scars HERE (https://audioboom.com/channels/4976076) and Subscribe to Radio Free Irish HERE (https://audioboom.com/channels/4011493) !

Later, they chat about how she stayed engaged with her team while not being able to play and detailed the steps she and the Notre Dame medical staff took to ensure she could recover healthily and safely throughout the year.
They also discuss what it was like to receive encouragement from so many family, friends, and fans, including NBA Star, Steph Curry (https://twitter.com/abbyproha/status/1195089160593453067?s=20) !

episodes.title: 3. Run It Back - 1992 ND Football vs USC - Reggie Brooks
episodes.description:
Welcome to "Run It Back"!  Over the course of this show, we will relive some of the best games in Notre Dame history with the players and personalities that made them memorable!
This episode features the Notre Dame Football's victory over USC in 1992.
Tony is joined by Jack Nolan and Reggie Brooks to discuss the significance of this win.  Notre Dame was attempting to win 10 straight against the Trojans and Reggie talks about how important it was to keep the streak alive.
Later, they chat about Reggie's career day (227 yards and 3 TDs) and what enabled him to have such a successful game against USC.
Finally, the group chats about Reggie's time as an employee at Notre Dame as an Assistant Athletic Director of Athletics Alumni Relations and his new role as the Executive Director of Holtz's Heroes!

episodes.title: 2. Run It Back - 2001 #3 Notre Dame vs. #1 UConn - Muffet McGraw, Niele Ivey, and Ruth Riley
episodes.description:
Welcome to "Run It Back"!  Over the course of this show, we will relive some of the best games in Notre Dame history with the players and personalities that made them memorable!
This episode features the Notre Dame Women's Basketball team and their dominant performance over UConn in 2001!
On this episode, Tony is joined by the Hall of Fame Coach, Muffet McGraw and two former players, Niele Ivey and Ruth Riley.  The group looks back at the storylines and biggest moments from the game and discusses the impact of this win on the Women's Basketball program.
The game marked the first sellout in Notre Dame Women's Basketball history, and the team's first win over UConn.  It was a pivotal win this team racked up en route the the 2001 National Championship!

episodes.description:
This is Unforgotten, Stories From a Lost Season.
In the third episode of Unforgotten, Tony chats with Notre Dame Men's Golfers, Hunter Ostrom (https://und.com/roster/hunter-ostrom/) , Davis Lamb (https://und.com/roster/davis-lamb/) , and John Fellito (https://und.com/roster/john-felitto/) .
The Notre Dame Men's Golf Team was having one of its best seasons in program history.  They won 4 of the first 5 tournaments they participated in this season (the previous record for wins in a season was 3!) and were ranked as high as 5th in the nation.
They were a threat to win the ACC Championship and contend for an NCAA title later in the spring before their season was cut short by the Coronavirus Pandemic.
Hunter, Davis, and John detail how they learned their season had come to an end, and how they are processing everything a month later.

episodes.description:
Welcome to "Run It Back"!  Over the course of this show, we will relive some of the best games in Notre Dame history with the players and personalities that made them memorable!
First up, it's the 1995 Notre Dame Football game vs. USC!  We strongly recommend watching this recap (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yVDohc7Gqn0&t=11s) or even this whole broadcast (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WxZFLjYyfOk) , before or during the podcast!
On this episode, Tony is joined by the quarterback of the 1995 Notre Dame Football team, and current Associate Athletics Director, Ron Powlus (https://und.com/coach/ron-powlus-2/) as well as the voice of Notre Dame athletics, Jack Nolan.
The group sets the stage and discusses the hype surrounding the 1995 USC game and how significant of a win it was at the time.  Then, they go through the game, and recount the biggest drives, plays, and moments that led to Notre Dame's 38-10 victory over Southern Cal!

In the second episode of Unforgotten, Tony chats with Notre Dame softball players, Alexis Holloway (https://und.com/roster/alexis-holloway/) and Abby Sweet (https://und.com/roster/abby-sweet/) .
After beginning the season 13-9, Notre Dame was ranked in the top 25 in the RPI and had a pair of ranked wins on their resume.  They were about a week away from returning to South Bend to play their first home game of the season before it was cut short.

In this week's episode, Bailey and Jon sit down with Notre Dame Football player, Daelin Hayes (https://und.com/roster/daelin-hayes/) . 
They discuss how Daelin has handled his injury this season and how he wants to make an impact off of the football field.
Later, they cover Daelin's involvement with the Irish Strong Initiative at Notre Dame and what he hopes to accomplish with his fellow student-athletes.
They also cover Daelin's national television debut from a few weeks ago when he was a part of NBC's Second Screen coverage of the Boston College Football game.
This was the first time Daelin really opened up about his injury and we appreciate him sharing his story on the podcast!
Make sure to rate and review!

episodes.title: 58: Podward Notre Dame - Rob Kelly - Senior Associate Athletics Director Media & Brand | Notre Dame Athletics ('03)
episodes.description:
Join hosts Tony Simeone and Jon Cotton of Fighting Irish Media as they take listeners on an insider tour of the projects and personalities behind Fighting Irish Media and the Notre Dame Athletics Department.
In this episode, Tony and Jon sit down with their bosses' bosses' boss, Rob Kelly (https://und.com/coach/rob-kelly-3/) !  As Senior Associate Athletics Director Media & Brand, Rob oversees all of Fighting Irish Media.  As he enters his 3rd year in the role, the guys discuss the biggest changes he has seen during his time with FIM.  
Later, they chat about the impact of the new FIM Mission Statement and how it has helped guide content strategies and decisions department wide.
At the end, they cover the future of media, and where Rob anticipates focusing FIM's efforts in the coming years.
This is another ALL-TIMER and a huge shoutout to Rob for making good on his promise to join us on the pod!
Remember to rate and review!!
Subscribe to Podward Notre Dame here! (https://audioboom.com/channels/4942689)

episodes.title: 57: Podward Notre Dame - Play-by-Play Broadcaster, Mike Monaco (ND '15)
episodes.description:
Join hosts Tony Simeone and Jon Cotton of Fighting Irish Media as they take listeners on an insider tour of the projects and personalities behind Fighting Irish Media and the Notre Dame Athletics Department.

In this episode, Tony and Jon take you behind the scenes of the best season opening Hype Video in college football (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oIIcPRJQVfE) !  We highly recommend watching the video before listening to this pod (it is just 80 seconds long!)
Jon produced the video and Tony wrote the script.  The guys go IN-DEPTH on how the video came to life.  Jon details the hours he spent agonizing over certain shots and how to walk the line between acknowledging the past without belaboring the point.
The guys also talk about how they were inspired by other content they have seen around sports video that helped guide them as the video came together. 
This is hopefully the first of many Behind The Scenes Episodes as FIM continues to pump out awesome content! 
Notre Dame podcasts are presented by Resonado, the official sound partner of Notre Dame Athletics. Learn more about how Resonado is changing the shape of sound at Resonado.com (http://resonado.com/) .

episodes.title: 53: Podward Notre Dame - Joey Mizutani - FIM Production Assistant ---> Boston College Creative Video Producer
episodes.description:
Join hosts Tony Simeone and Jon Cotton of Fighting Irish Media as they take listeners on an insider tour of the projects and personalities behind Fighting Irish Media and the Notre Dame Athletics Department.
In this episode, Tony and Jon sit down with Production Assistant, Joey Mizutani on his last day of work at FIM!  Joey has recently accepted a job with Boston College as their Creative Video Producer.
The guys discuss Joey's 18 months at FIM and how he developed as a producer and editor.  They recap his work with Notre Dame hockey during their run to the national championship game in 2018 and how he was able to thrive after being thrown into the fire in his first few months with FIM!
To start the show, Jon and Tony call Joey during his second week in Boston to check on on the new job and see how he is adjusting to life back on the east coast!
This was a bittersweet episode to record.  We are fired up for Joey's new gig but will miss his contributions to FIM!

In today's episode, Tony and Jon chat with Assistant Athletic Director of Strategic Communications, Aaron Horvath.  As one of the longest tenured employees with FIM, Aaron provides a great perspective on how the department as evolved over the years.  

The guys cover Aaron's transition through various departments within FIM and his new managerial role within Communications.  

Also, shoutout to Aaron for being our podcast chaperone.  Every week, he reviews the rough draft of the podcast to ensure that the hosts remain employed!  This podcast is forever indebted to Aaron's detailed listenership.  

Remember to rate and review!!

Subscribe to Podward Notre Dame [here](https://audioboom.com/channels/4942689)!

episodes.title: 16: Podward Notre Dame - Tim O'Connor (FIM Director of Brand)
episodes.description:
Join hosts Tony Simeone and Jon Cotton of Fighting Irish Media as they take listeners on an insider tour of the projects and personalities behind Fighting Irish Media, the video production and media services division of Notre Dame Athletics.

In today's episode, Tony and Jon chat with FIM Director of Brand, Tim O'Connor (Oak).  The group covers his unique role within FIM and how he focuses on optimizing the Notre Dame brand.

Then the guys get very meta and chat about Podward Notre Dame and podcasts as a whole.  They workshop the current format of the show and try to figure out the best way to improve the podcast!  

Thanks to Oak for taking the time to spitball some podcasting ideas...we promise to have him on again to actually talk more about brand!

Subscribe to Podward Notre Dame [here](https://audioboom.com/channels/4942689)!

episodes.title: 15: Podward Notre Dame - Micaela Powers '18 and Denise Dorotheo '18
episodes.description:
Join hosts Tony Simeone and Jon Cotton of Fighting Irish Media as they take listeners on an insider tour of the projects and personalities behind Fighting Irish Media, the video production and media services division of Notre Dame Athletics.

In today's episode, Tony and Jon chat with two of FIM's graduating student workers, Micaela Powers and Denise Dorotheo.  Both have been with FIM for three years and the group discusses all of the different production work they have accomplished during their time on campus.  

Both Denise and Micaela recently graduated and are headed to exciting professional endeavors.  Micaela will be working with NFL Films and Denise snagged a gig with the Orlando Magic!

This was a fun one that once again grounded the guys in the reality that they are washed and the Notre Dame students that help FIM are much cooler.

episodes.title: 13: Podward Notre Dame - Nathan Bush (FIM Producer)
episodes.description:
Join hosts Tony Simeone and Jon Cotton of Fighting Irish Media as they take listeners on an insider tour of the projects and personalities behind Fighting Irish Media, the video production and media services division of Notre Dame Athletics.

In today's episode, Tony and Jon sit down with FIM Producer, Nathan Bush.  As the longest tenured producer in the live broadcasting wing of FIM, Bush has plenty of stories to share in this episode!

episodes.description:
Join hosts Tony Simeone and Jon Cotton of Fighting Irish Media as they take listeners on an insider tour of the projects and personalities behind Fighting Irish Media, the video production and media services division of Notre Dame Athletics.

In today's episode, Tony and Jon sit down with Notre Dame Student Broadcaster, Nik Valdiserri. The guys chat about Nik's on-air experience during his time with FIM and where his head is at as he prepares to graduate in a few weeks.

episodes.title: 28: The Jack Swarbrick Show - Katie Beriont, Cam Morrison, Mikey Wynne, Kevin Corrigan
episodes.description:
Jack Swarbrick, University Vice President and James E. Rohr Director of Athletics is joined by co-host Jack Nolan to discuss the latest in Irish Athletics for the final episode of the 2017-18 season. 

In segment 1 (0:20) Jack and Jack discuss: the recent Big Ten Tournament Championship for Hockey, a great Saint Patrick’s day weekend for Notre Dame Athletics, the great atmosphere and fan support at the Men’s Basketball game against Penn State, what happened to last week’s recording, Bonzie Colson’s senior moment and more

Guest Segments include:

*   (15:25) - Katie Beriont, Pitcher, Notre Dame Softball  

*   (26:15) - Cam Morrison, Forward, Notre Dame Hockey  

*   (35:40) - Mikey Wynne, Attack, Notre Dame Men's Lacrosse and Kevin Corrigan, Head Coach, Notre Dame Men's Lacrosse

Jack and Jack then conclude with a wrap up of the 2017-18 Jack Swarbrick Show season. We'll be back in the fall, so please keep your subscriptions active. 

[You can subscribe to all episodes of the Jack Swarbrick Show here](https://audioboom.com/channel/jackswarbrickradioshow).

And for more great Fighting Irish podcast content check out our new show Podward Notre Dame, a look behind the scenes of Fighting Irish Media [available here](https://audioboom.com/channels/4942689) or through whatever podcast directory you prefer.
